title: 'We will only celebrate if we win the World Cup', says Wales flanker Aaron Wainwright
text:
Aaron Wainwright declared Wales would only celebrate if they win the World Cup after his man-of-the-match display took Warren Gatland’s side into the semi-finals.

Rookie flanker Wainwright, 22, scored a try, put in a titanic shift, and even took a brutal elbow to the head from France’s Sebastien Vahaamahina for which the Les Bleus lock was red carded.

It allowed Wales – who produced a poor overall display – to come out on top thanks to Ross Moriarty’s late try. Wainwright said: “I was in the maul and he (Vahaamahina) had me by the neck to start off with. I was trying to get the referee’s attention as he was pulling me back.

“Then the elbow came in. I was a bit surprised the referee didn’t...
description: Aaron Wainwright declared Wales would only celebrate if they win the World Cup after his man-of-the-match display took Warren Gatland’s side into the semi-finals.
